content.raw:
> `const *Contact Cont() const`

I think the `const` return type was meant to make these DOM objects readonly. I found that as we do more integration with ign-gazebo, there’s need to populate these objects manually instead of reading everything from an sdf element. So I think it’s ok to make it non-const, e.g. I didn’t make the return type const [here](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/aab66b9e2f56d50ff345c50dfb4cff0e062fe7bf/include/sdf/Material.hh#lines-187).
content.html:
const *Contact Cont() const

I think the const return type was meant to make these DOM objects readonly. I found that as we do more integration with ign-gazebo, there’s need to populate these objects manually instead of reading everything from an sdf element. So I think it’s ok to make it non-const, e.g. I didn’t make the return type const here.
